_header: When busy at my book I was upon a certain night
Note:
Edition without specified source is Ashmole (1652)
XAshmole, Elias. Theatrum Chemicum Britannicum. London: J. Grimond, 1652, 374.
Title(s): The Vision of Sir George Ripley, Canon of Bridlington
_description: George Ripley, The Vision of Sir George Ripley, Canon of Bridlington — 24 lines

BodAsh1480.First Lines:
When busi att my booke I was vpon a certayne nightethis vision
                    heare exprest apered vnto my dimed sight…
BodAsh1480.Last Lines:
…Then of this venom handled thus a medicine I did makewhiche
                    medicine kylls all venom wilde if any chance to take

BodAsh1485.First Lines:
When busy at my booke I was vppon a certain nightthis vision heare
                    exprest appeered to my sight…
BodAsh1485.Last Lines:
…Glory be to the grauntor of such secreat waiesdomynion and
                    honour both with woorship and with prayse
BodAsh1485.Attributed Title:
The vision of Sir George Ripley Channon of Briddlimgton (f.
                    46v)

BodRawPoe121.First Lines:
When busie at my booke I was vppon acertayne nightThis vision heare
                    exprest appeared vnto my sighte…
BodRawPoe121.Last Lines:
…Glorye be to hime the graunter of suche secrette
                    waiesDominion and honour bothe with worshipe and with praise
BodRawPoe121.Attributed Title: The vizion of sir George Ripley chanoun (f. 35)
